methods.name: search
methods.comment:
Searches the given addressSet for strings. 
 
 Note: The address set searched will be modified before searching in the following ways:
  if the given set is null, it will be re-initialized to encompass all of program memory
  the set will be further culled to only include loaded memory blocks, if specified

params.name: addressSet
params.comment: the address set to search over; if null, will initialized to all memory

params.name: callback
params.comment: the callback invoked when a string is found

params.name: searchLoadedMemoryBlocksOnly
params.comment: if true, will exclude unloaded memory blocks from the search

return.comment: the updated address set used for the search

methods.name: updateAddressesToSearch
methods.comment:
Returns a new address set that is the intersection of the given set with the
 desired memory block addresses (loaded or unloaded).
 
 Note: This desired set of memory blocks is known by inspecting the 
 StringTableOptions#useLoadedBlocksOnly() attribute set by the user.

params.name: useLoadedBlocksOnly
params.comment: if true, only return addresses in loaded memory blocks
